name: HVAC Technician Training
shortTagline: Learn to keep homes, schools, and businesses comfortable year-round.
heroImageAlt: Student working on an HVAC unit with an instructor.
schedule: Evening and weekend options available in most cohorts
tuitionNotes: Tuition can often be covered through WIOA, Workforce grants, or employer sponsorship.
fundingOptions: Payment plan options available in some locations
whoItIsFor: Adult learners ready for a skilled trade with strong earning potential
People who like working with their hands, tools, and problem-solving
Career changers coming from retail, hospitality, warehouse, or low-wage work
outcomes: Graduate with the skills to work as an entry-level HVAC technician or apprentice
Learn fundamentals of heating, ventilation, air conditioning, and refrigeration
Gain experience reading gauges, troubleshooting common issues, and working safely
Prepare for industry-recognized credentials where available (varies by partner site)
highlights: Hands-on labs with real HVAC equipment
Career coaching and job search support
Stackable with other building trades and maintenance programs
Designed to align with local employer needs and apprenticeship pathways

name: Barber Apprenticeship Pathway
shortTagline: Earn while you learn in a licensed barber shop environment.
heroImageAlt: Apprentice barber practicing a fade on a client.
schedule: Flexible schedules set with your sponsoring shop
tuitionNotes: Many apprenticeship hours are paid. Some related instruction may be grant or employer funded.
fundingOptions: Registered apprenticeship and OJT support where available
Workforce and apprenticeship grants (varies by region)
whoItIsFor: Future barbers who want a real shop experience, not just a classroom
Creatives who love hair, conversation, and community
Individuals who want to build a long-term career and potentially own a shop
outcomes: Complete a structured barber apprenticeship with on-the-job hours
Gain real client experience with supervision and coaching
Prepare to meet state licensing or examination requirements (varies by state)
Build a strong professional portfolio and client base while in training
highlights: Learn fades, shaves, beard work, and customer service skills
On-the-job mentoring from experienced barbers and shop owners
Career and financial literacy support (pricing, clientele, shop ownership basics)
Apprenticeship hours tracked and aligned with state regulations where applicable

ctaSecondary.label: Talk with a Barber Pathway Coach

name: Certified Nursing Assistant (CNA) Training
shortTagline: Step into healthcare with a high-impact, high-demand CNA credential.
heroImageAlt: CNA student practicing vital signs on a manikin.
format: Classroom, skills lab, and clinical experience
schedule: Day, evening, or weekend cohorts where available
tuitionNotes: CNA training is often fully covered by workforce funding, healthcare employers, or scholarships.
fundingOptions: Hospital, long-term care, or agency sponsorships
whoItIsFor: Compassionate people ready to serve patients and residents
Adults exploring healthcare careers like LPN, RN, or medical assistant
Career changers seeking stable, in-demand work with impact
outcomes: Complete state-approved CNA training with classroom, lab, and clinical hours
Prepare to sit for the CNA exam in your state (where offered through partners)
Build confidence in direct patient care, communication, and safety
Open doors to hospitals, long-term care, home health, and more
highlights: Small cohort sizes and supportive instructors (through partner schools)
Practice with equipment and real-world scenarios before clinicals
Job search and resume support focused on healthcare roles
Stackable toward additional healthcare credentials over time

name: Building Technician & Maintenance
shortTagline: Learn the skills to keep buildings safe, clean, and operating smoothly.
heroImageAlt: Building maintenance trainee using tools in a facility.
schedule: Day or evening cohorts where available
tuitionNotes: Frequently eligible for workforce and employer-sponsored funding.
fundingOptions: Public housing, facilities, and employer sponsorships
Grants focused on building trades and infrastructure
whoItIsFor: Problem-solvers who enjoy hands-on work, tools, and variety
Individuals interested in facilities, property management, or trades
People who want stable, year-round work with growth potential
outcomes: Understand core building systems (basic electrical, plumbing, HVAC support, safety)
Gain experience with routine maintenance, inspections, and work orders
Learn professional communication with residents, tenants, and supervisors
Prepare for roles in facilities, housing authorities, schools, and more
highlights: Cross-training that connects to HVAC and building systems
Real-world maintenance projects and simulations
Career coaching for facilities and property roles
Stackable with other Elevate trades and technical pathways

name: CDL & Transportation Careers
shortTagline: Get on the road to a transportation career with strong earning potential.
heroImageAlt: CDL student near a commercial truck with an instructor.
duration: Varies by partner school and license class
format: Classroom, simulation, and behind-the-wheel training (through partners)
schedule: Intensive or part-time schedules depending on provider
tuitionNotes: Many learners qualify for workforce funding or employer sponsorship.
fundingOptions: Workforce board funding where CDL programs are approved
Veteran and special initiative funding where available
whoItIsFor: Adults ready to travel, drive, and work independently
People seeking a path to higher earning potential in transportation
Career changers coming from warehouse, labor, or service roles
outcomes: Connect with partner schools that provide CDL training
Receive support with applications, funding, and next steps
Prepare for in-demand roles in transportation and logistics
Build a plan for long-term career growth, not just a one-time license
highlights: Guidance on matching you with the right CDL program and provider
Support navigating funding, sponsorships, and paperwork
Career coaching around lifestyle, routes, and long-term goals
Connections to broader Elevate workforce services beyond CDL

name: Career Readiness & Life Design
shortTagline: Build confidence, clarity, and a plan for your next chapter.
heroImageAlt: Adult learners in a workshop, working together at a table.
schedule: Flexible formats, including evenings and community-based sessions
tuitionNotes: Often grant-funded or provided at no cost to the learner through partners.
fundingOptions: Embedded within other Elevate training pathways
whoItIsFor: Adults who feel stuck and want a clear next step
People re-entering the workforce after a break or transition
Learners who want help with resumes, interviews, and confidence
outcomes: Create a realistic career and training plan that fits your life
Build a resume that actually tells your story and skills
Practice interview skills and real-world conversations
Learn how to stack credentials and move into higher-wage roles
highlights: Human, judgment-free coaching and community support
Tools designed for real barriers (childcare, transportation, confidence)
Connections to Elevate programs and partner opportunities
Can be bundled with trades, healthcare, or apprenticeship pathways
